result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas M Lamon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 09/29/2014 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR DEFENDANT TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM. DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR CHALLENGE INCARCERATION PROGRAM.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or drugs unless prescribed.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with the co-defendant's or any Target Stores. Attend a Criminal Thinking course if deemed appropriate by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nickolas M Lamon in court with Attorney Megan Barbara.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #6.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #6.  Count #7 is dismissed and read-in.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Barbara makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #6:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Co-Defendant's or any Target stores
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Criminal thinking class (if deemed appropriate by agent)

COSTS:  $278.00  &  $250  DNA surcharge if not already paid  (to be paid as a condition of probation)  NOTE:  CASH BAIL POSTED IS NOT TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS - RETURN TO PERSON WHO POSTED IT

CONDITION TIME:   60 DAYS HUBER - STAYED- to be used at agent's discretion

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 03/05/14.
